com.samsung.android.sdk.composer.document

Class SpenSDoc

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.composer.document.SpenSDoc

  • public class SpenSDoc
extends Object
    SDoc class

    This class provides the functionality for managing the data of an SDOC file and provides methods for loading and saving the file, adding and removing the Content, and attaching external files.
    Content index -1 is reserved for title content.
    The Maximum text length is 30000 for a single SDoc. And the Maximum title length is 50.
    Since:
    5.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SpenSDoc.ContentEventListener
      This listener interface is called when adding/removing/changing contents.
      static interface  SpenSDoc.ContentTextChangedListener
      This listener interface is called when the text exceed the limitation.
      static class  SpenSDoc.CursorInfo
      CursorInfo class

      This class represents the cursor position.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpenSDoc

        public SpenSDoc(Context context,
                String fileFullPath,
                String password,
                int mode)
         throws SpenSDocUnsupportedFileException,
                SpenSDocInvalidPasswordException,
                SpenSDocUnsupportedVersionException,
                IOException
        Creates a SpenSDoc instance with the specified file path.
        If file is existed, then load the file. If not, creates a new file.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        fileFullPath - The absolute path of the file.
        password - The password for a protected file.
        mode - Set to specified integer to open SDoc with separated cache directory. If the mode is different, then you can use separated cache directory without conflict.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated.
        SpenSDocUnsupportedFileException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenSDocInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the password passed is invalid.
        SpenSDocUnsupportedVersionException - Thrown if the file version can not be supported.
        Since:
        5.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Close the SDoc instance.
        This method deletes the useless data of a SDoc before closing it. To close a SDoc, call close() or discard(). If you use a SDoc instance after calling close() or discard(), an exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory or its files cannot be deleted.
        SpenAlreadyClosedException - Thrown if the SDoc is already called close() or discard().
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        discard(), reserveDiscard(boolean)

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Check SDoc is closed or not.
        Returns:
        If SDoc is already closed, return true. Otherwise, return false.

      • discard

        public void discard()
        Discard the SDoc instance.
        This method deletes the new data before closing the SDoc. To close a SDoc, call close() or discard(). If you use a SDoc instance after calling close() or discard(), an exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory or its files cannot be deleted.
        SpenAlreadyClosedException - Thrown if the SDoc is already called close() or discard().
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        close()

        public void unlock()

      • appendContent

        public void appendContent(SpenContentBase content)
                   throws SpenExceedImageLimitException,
                          SpenExceedTextLimitException
        Append the specified content.
        Parameters:
        content - The content to be appended to SDoc.
        Throws:
        SpenExceedImageLimitException - Thrown if the count of image in the SDoc is over than specified size. Default max image count is 100.
        SpenExceedTextLimitException - Thrown if the count of text in the SDoc is over than specified size. Default max text count is 30000.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • insertContent

        public void insertContent(SpenContentBase content,
                          int index)
                   throws SpenExceedImageLimitException,
                          SpenExceedTextLimitException
        Insert the specified content at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        content - The content to be inserted to SDoc.
        index - The specified index
        Throws:
        SpenExceedImageLimitException - Thrown if the count of image in the SDoc is over than specified size. Default max image count is 100.
        SpenExceedTextLimitException - Thrown if the count of text in the SDoc is over than specified size. Default max text count is 30000.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if index is invalid.
        Since:
        5.0.0

        Throws:

      • bindFile

        public int bindFile(String filePath)
             throws IOException
        Bind specified file in SDoc.
        The binding file is included in SDoc. The SDoc check the binding files and reference count for preventing bind duplicate files and excluding 0 reference count files.
        If same file is already bound, increase reference count. User can control binding files by binding id.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The absolute path of the files.
        Returns:
        The binding id.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the file is not found.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if filePath is null.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        bindFile(int), releaseFile(String), releaseFile(int), clearAllBoundFiles(), getBoundFilePath(int)

      • bindFile

        public int bindFile(int id)
        Bind specified file in SDoc by binding id.
        The binding file is included in SDoc. The SDoc check the binding files and reference count for preventing bind duplicate files and excluding 0 reference count files.
        If same file is already bound, increase reference count. User can control binding files by binding id.
        Parameters:
        id - The binding id.
        Returns:
        The binding id.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if id is invalid.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        bindFile(String), releaseFile(String), releaseFile(int), clearAllBoundFiles(), getBoundFilePath(int)

      • releaseFile

        public void releaseFile(String filePath)
                 throws IOException
        Release specified file in SDoc.
        Decrease reference count of bound file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The absolute path of the file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the file is not found.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if filePath is null.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        bindFile(String), bindFile(int), releaseFile(int), clearAllBoundFiles(), getBoundFilePath(int)

      • releaseFile

        public void releaseFile(int id)

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if id is invalid.
        Since:

      • save

        public void save(String fileFullPath,
                 String password)
          throws IOException
        Save the SDoc to specified file path with password.
        If document is locked, document saved with specified password.
        It document is not locked, password is ignored.
        Parameters:
        fileFullPath - The absolute file path to save SDoc.
        password - The password of locked SDoc file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if fail to save SDoc file.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if document is locked, but password is null.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        #lock()}, #unlock()}

      • save

        public void save(String fileFullPath,
                 String password,
                 boolean fixCache)
          throws IOException
        Save the SDoc to specified file path.
        If document is locked, document saved with specified password.
        It document is not locked, password is ignored.
        Parameters:
        fileFullPath - The absolute file path to save SDoc.
        password - The password of locked SDoc file.
        fixCache - If true, don't change cache directory even if fileFullPath is different from the file path of current SDoc.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if fail to save SDoc file.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if document is locked, but password is null.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        #lock()}, #unlock()}

      • save

        public void save(String fileFullPath,
                 String password,
                 long createdTime,
                 long modifiedTime)
          throws IOException,
                 IllegalArgumentException
        Save the SDoc to specified file path.
        If document is locked, document saved with specified password.
        It document is not locked, password is ignored.
        Parameters:
        fileFullPath - The absolute file path to save SDoc.
        password - The password of locked SDoc file.
        createdTime - The created time to display.
        modifiedTime - The modified time to display.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if fail to save SDoc file.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if document is locked, but password is null.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        #lock()}, #unlock()}

      • save

        public void save(String fileFullPath,
                 String password,
                 boolean fixCache,
                 long createdTime,
                 long modifiedTime)
          throws IOException,
                 IllegalArgumentException
        Save the SDoc to specified file path.
        If document is locked, document saved with specified password.
        It document is not locked, password is ignored.
        Parameters:
        fileFullPath - The absolute file path to save SDoc.
        password - The password of locked SDoc file.
        fixCache - If true, don't change cache directory even if fileFullPath is different from the file path of current SDoc.
        createdTime - The created time to display.
        modifiedTime - The modified time to display.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if fail to save SDoc file.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if document is locked, but password is null.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        #lock()}, #unlock()}

      • backupContentList

        public void backupContentList(ArrayList<SpenContentBase> contentList,
                              String filePath)
                       throws IOException
        Save the specified content list to the specified file.
        You can restore the saved file to the content list by calling restoreContentList(String).
        Parameters:
        contentList - The content list that you want to save.
        filePath - The absolute path of the file to save.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if fail to save filePath.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the contentList is null or has no item.
        Thrown if the filePath is null or length is 0.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        restoreContentList(String)

      • restoreContentList

        public ArrayList<SpenContentBase> restoreContentList(String filePath)
                                              throws IOException
        Restore the content list from the specified file.
        You can save the content list as a file by calling backupContentList(ArrayList, String).
        Parameters:
        filePath - The absolute path of the saved backup file.
        Returns:
        The restored content list.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the file is not found.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if filePath is null.
        SpenSDocUnsupportedFileException - Thrown if the file is not in SDoc file format.
        SpenSDocUnsupportedVersionException - Thrown if the version if SDoc file is not supported.
        Since:
        5.0.0
        See Also:
        backupContentList(ArrayList, String)

      • hasExtraDataInt

        public boolean hasExtraDataInt(String key)
        Check if the extra integer data with the specified key is present.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for the data.
        Returns:
        True, if the extra integer data with the key is present. False, if the extra integer data with the key is not present.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • hasExtraDataString

        public boolean hasExtraDataString(String key)
        Check if the extra string data with the specified key is present.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for the data.
        Returns:
        True, if the extra integer data with the key is present. False, if the extra integer data with the key is not present.
        Since:
        5.0.0

      • hasExtraDataByteArray

        public boolean hasExtraDataByteArray(String key)
        Check if the extra byte array data with the specified key is present.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for the data.
        Returns:
        True, if the extra integer data with the key is present. False, if the extra integer data with the key is not present.
        Since:
        5.0.0
